name: Stainless steel rack

Client is a stage 4A Cervical Cancer patient. She is unemployed and has to financially support her two teenage children. Client would like to attend online courses to upgrade herself so that she could explore possible employment. However, she does not have the financial means to purchase a laptop. 

Recently, client reported that her kitchen cabinet was infested with cockroaches and she found it challenging to maintain the cabinet, due to her current health condition. Therefore, she hopes to get a stainless-steel rack instead, for easy maintenance.

She is also hoping to get a kitchen cabinet so that she can store the kitchen appliances including the microwave oven out of reach from her children. Client is appealing for support from donors for these items as the family cannot afford them due to a lack of financial resources.

Even the smallest donation will make a big difference to other’s lives. We greatly appreciate your kind donation and generosity to the children and the society!

He has financial difficulties and is under tremendous caregiver's stress. He would require the chair (bed) for his brother who sleeps on it. Currently, his chair is filled with bed bugs and would have to be removed.

Social worker would like to request for a chair that is comfortable enough for client to sleep in.

SSFR @ Children's Society helps children and young persons who have been placed in foster or institutional care to be reunified with their families, in a safe and timely manner.

           vegetables – any amount

3        Milo packet drinks x 2 packs of 6s
4        Toilet paper x 2 rolls

Please contact us for delivery details. Note: Delivery costs will be covered by donors. 

Even the smallest donation will make a big difference to other’s lives. We greatly appreciate your kind donation and generosity to the children and the society!

name: Washing Machine

However, he has not been earning a regular income due to his poor work attendance, health conditions and addiction issues. Client is medically certified unfit to work. They are mainly dependent on SSO financial assistance for family sustenance. 

The family will require a new/second-hand top load washer as their current washing machine recently stopped working; the washing machine has been in use for 10 years and cannot be repaired. 

The family received a donated second-hand washing machine on 11 May 2021 via Pass-It-On. However, the washing machine is not working too. There was leaking water when the machine is in use. Hence, client had to mop/dry the floor throughout the washing period.

name: Washing Machine
description:
Mdm Shakila is a single mother, raising 3 children in her household. 

She is currently unemployed due to caregiving responsibilities as well as her multiple physical health concerns. 
Mdm Shakila's washing machine has broken down recently and is unable to afford a new washing machine. She has been washing her family's clothes and bedsheets manually, but her multiple physical ailments have made it difficult for her to do so. Her children has eczema so she is not able to cut down on her washing. 


As such, case worker would like to request for donations for a washing machine for the family. This would help Mdm Shakila with maintaining the cleanliness and hygiene of the home environment for her and her children. 

We request for the donor would have to bear the cost of moving as well. 
A washing machine with Top Open, 15kg, preferably with drying function.

name: Pocket Talker
description:
Mr Neo is a 73-year-old elderly client of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC), who is residing alone in a 2-room rental flat. He has difficulty hearing and is only able to communicate through manual writing. 

THKMC is looking for a Pocket Talker to assist Mr Neo with his hearing. With the Pocket Talker, we hope that Mr Neo will be able to participate and enjoy the activities at THK Seniors Activity Centres with his peers more meaningfully. 

If you know of someone who has the item for donation, please contact Patrick Foo at 8778 8712. The recipient is located at Ang Mo Kio Avenue 3.

Since October 2011, THKMC was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the Elderly, Families, Children & Youth, and Persons with Disabilities, through more than 70 programmes and services.

THK Elderly Services Division provides many programmes and services to serve the elderly in need – one of which includes THK Cluster Support. THK Cluster Support provides social support through case management, monitoring, and basic counselling services to vulnerable seniors, and facilitates coordination in the provision of community-based care and support services to the seniors. This service aims to improve the quality of life of vulnerable seniors, particularly for low or no income seniors who are socially-isolated and have minimal or no family support.

name: Washing Machine
description: Client is a 53 year old who is living on his own in a rental flat. Client has multiple chronic diseases. His wife and son are in Thailand and unable to be with him in Singapore due to Covid. Client just moved into his rental flat and does not have a washing machine. It will help him a lot if he has a washing machine that can reduce his time of washing his clothes by hand and spend more time working and taking care of his health
